Awww yiss. Swelling to 92 tons, the Heavy Drek XVI is the largest, most complex, and after a compete redesign of the rear fuselage, strongest of the Drekevak Family. 2 Helios Bolts (by FallingIntoBlack) and 6 HV broadside missiles, and 1100m/s D/V without refueling. 5 engines of diffrent types assure an engine strike will not cripple the battlewagon.

Oh, and these things can LITERALLY bounce a ramming Bayonet at 30m/s, suffering no damage while severely hurting the offending ship.

Edited October 8, 2013 by zekes
don't see which one but ok
Wait that thing only has 8 shots... I think I've been piling too much armament on my ships. No wonder they go into the lag zone. xD

Awww yiss. Swelling to 92 tons, the Heavy Drek XVI is the largest, most complex, and after a compete redesign of the rear fuselage, strongest of the Drekevak Family. 2 Helios Bolts (by FallingIntoBlack) and 6 HV broadside missiles, and 1100m/s D/V without refueling. 5 engines of diffrent types assure an engine strike will not cripple the battlewagon.

Oh, and these things can LITERALLY bounce a ramming Bayonet at 30m/s, suffering no damage while severely hurting the offending ship.

lol. No but seriously i found a way to protect fuel tanks and make the whole ship have Impact Tolerance 80.... the thing is so strong. Seriously, you thought the E-Class was good, but i guarantee this thing... is... just... wow.

So far it's been hit by 5 SRBs, 1 Helios, and 3 Bayonets, and the worst damage it took was damage to the superstructure. The E-Class is paper to this.

@Dameoncaprix It only has 8, but two of them are 10 ton heavy ship killers. Can gut even the best armor in one shot.

EDIT: Due to it's large size, the Heavy Drek Mk XIV is being renamed from a "Medium Destoyer" to a "Medium Cruiser" Even though it technically still fits into the Destroyer Class, just because it is 20 tons heavier than normal Dreks.
